alert.note: Alert for Okaloosa (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 5:35AM EDT until further notice by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Florida, including the following county, Okaloosa. * WHEN...Until 745 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas and some area roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 431 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated bands of showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rain moving across southeastern Okaloosa county from near Destin to near Eglin AFB and Niceville. These storms will be capable of quickly producing between 1 and 2 inches of rain which may cause flooding of low lying areas and along some area roadways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Walton Beach, Niceville, Destin, Eglin AFB, Valparaiso, Lake Lorraine, Shalimar, Cinco Bayou, Eglin Village, Postil and Longwood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
